channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: I sustained a blow out of my tyre on the evening of 16th Jan at 17:30. The pot hole is very deep and long and unmarked. It made me scream out in shock ., 18th January
item.description:
You pass Crippets Lane in your left and the long pot hole is in the middle aspect of the road unfilled and unmarked. There are other potholes that have obviously been filled with tarmac.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leckhampton Lane, Shurdington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Several potholes end of hall rd, 18th January
item.description:
Potholes not repaired!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Hall Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The road drain is blocked but i've seen water coming out the drain so believe the main pipe for the ditch drain is blocked leading to all the water that should go into the river ending up blocking the road., 18th January
item.description:
The blockage has been a problem for near a year now. It's not just blocked as water leaves the road, the pipe from the ditch to I think the river is blocked or collapsed ending up with all the ditch water flooding out of the road drains into the road and remaining there. Please help as you can no longer walk down the road and it doesn't clear.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Gloucester Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pot hole, 18th January
item.description:
As you turn in to humber place right hand side hard to avoid when vehicles are parked on roadside
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Humber Place, Brockworth, Tewkesbury

item.title: Long pothole along kerb & broken collapsed kerb due to people parking on the verge. Note pothole at kerb in front of gate of 71 causes car to jump slip on reversing in gate. At some point a vehicle is likely to slip & take out a gate post & that’s a 4K cost., 18th January
item.description:
Kerb & verge between 71 & 73 Painswick Road & kerb at centre of gate to 71.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 80, Painswick Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole damaging cars, 18th January
item.description:
Absolute disgrace the amount of times this pothole has been reported here and "fixed". This has just severly damaged my wheel and tyre. Clearly it has not been repaired properly. The state of the roads in Gloucestershire are disgraceful and this is pure neglect the amount of times it has been reported in the last few months and shown as "Fixed". What3Words ///scoping.maple.painted right next to the twin sign post, travelling north bound.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): B4070, Coberley, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deep pothole in east bound carriageway, 18th January
item.description:
Approximately 50 metres west of Ermin Street entrance to Subway. No photo possible as dark when it was felt.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ermin Street, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deep pothole on Goldsmith Road, 18th January
item.description:
Big pothole on Goldsmith road, middle of carriageway. As a cyclist it is right in my path as I’m cycling past the cars which are parked on the left hand side (if I’m travelling towards the junction with Shakespeare road). It is VERY deep. It would cause me to come off the bike if I hit it. It is very difficult to avoid in busy traffic. It makes the road feel quite unsafe. There are other potholes in the area and loose material across the carriageway from the broken up road surface. It really needs filing as a priority please.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 21, Goldsmith Road, St Mark's, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Extremely dangerous, 18th January

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Mill Lane, Brockworth, Gloucester
